captions.text:
Prepare for the final installment of the Twilight
franchise

that tweens and lonely moms have been waiting
for,
and that dads could not care less about

The tedious book that was turned into two
bloated movies just to squeeze more money

Featuring the wedding that attempts to justify
the franchise's creepy

Because remember, he's like a hundred years
old and she's still a

And the honeymoon where Mouth Breather and
Shovel Face finally have sex...

Prompting the pro-life message that abortion
is never okay...

even when a monster vampire baby tries to
eat itself out of its mother's womb.

And creating an awful new baby name for an
entire generation of Teen

Witness, Teen Wolf finally getting over Dead
Eyes by instead falling in love with her creepy
"So should I start calling you dad?"

But when Mouthbreather nearly dies during
childbirth, Shovel Face

must transform her from a human who can't
act...
"Why can't you see how perfectly happy I am?"
to a vampire who can't act.

"You nicknamed my daughter after the Lochness
monster!?"

Honestly, even the movie had to teach her
how to act human.
"Blink at least three times a minute."

Brace yourself, for two movies so unnecessarily
long, that they include
two montages of the previous Twilight movies

Suffer through four hours of painfully stupid
characters,
like this pack of dogs who bark English

The Cullens, who spend every movie standing
around watching people

A grandfather who doesn't notice that his
own grandaughter has aged
eight years over the course of a few months.

And Kristen Stewart, and her inability to
use toothpaste.

Filmmaking so lazy that vampires no longer
sparkle even in direct sunlight
Sex ed is done through Yahoo searches
And the ultimate climax of all five movies...

So he's gonna have to live with Kristen
Stewart forever? I'd rather get my head

Hey, why not do us a solid and revisit all
4 Twilight trailers.

comments.text:
lol My dad was bored and wanted to watch a movie and somehow ended up 
picking up Twilight on accident and bought it. For the next month I tried 
desperately to stop him from buying the rest... He did.
Not because he liked it or anything, he just wanted to finish the saga 
(despite how bad I told him it was).
Though, my snarky comments throughout the five movie nights were fun though.





But seriously.... WTF dad?﻿
